website_summaries.verdict: A high-value spot treatment for offices, game rooms, and other small spaces.
pros: Don’t break the bank with this 12-pack of sound-dampening tiles
These help foster a quiet environment by eliminating excessive reverb and noise
Comes in wacky colors like neon green, purple, and fluorescent orange to add a personal touch
cons: The improvements here are largely cosmetic, as the sound adsorption properties aren’t spectacular

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Flammable
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 0 stars if I could. I was somewhat skeptical about the claim of being TB117 compliant despite being way less expensive than others that are properly fire retardant, so I ripped off part of a panel and exposed it to an open flame. The whole thing caught fire and melted in seconds. I wasn't expecting too much acoustical performance for the price, but lying about being flame retardant is unforgivable at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: I have a quick mounting solution.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I expected. Great for my starter/mini recording studio. As far as mounting, I placed some Scotch double stick indoor mounting squares on the back of them. Then I placed painters tape on the wall and then pressed the mounting tape against that. The purpose of the painters tape is so that the scotch squares don't rip the paint off the wall.
customer_reviews.author: theNecksLevel

customer_reviews.title: BASICALLY NAPALM
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for napalm wall panels, go for it. Product description states: MADE IN USA - Fire Retardant: CA Technical Bulletin 117 Video, well, is self explanatory. This product should be removed from the marketplace as it’s clearly false advertising and extremely dangerous and potentially life threatening to mislead consumers in this way.... not to mention illegal.
customer_reviews.author: Jern

customer_reviews.title: It looks and sounds great, my family thinks that I am really loud
customer_reviews.text: The products came not too long after I purchased it. It looks and sounds great, my family thinks that I am really loud, (which I kinda am), and this really helps block some sound coming from my room. Mainly from the music and videogames being played in there.
customer_reviews.author: Aaryan Bharati

customer_reviews.title: Great for door / wall soundproofing!
customer_reviews.text: I share an out of use internal door in a subdivided house with my neighbors. The door was very transparent to noise (not that my neighbors are especially loud, just that we probably do not want to be listening to each others conversations all of the time). I bought 24 of these acoustic wedges (only needed 16 in the end) and attached them to the door to create a sound barrier. They do a great job! I would say that the noise level on both sides of the house has been cut 75%. I do not know how they might compare to the competition, but I would definitely recommend them to renters looking for an inexpensive sound muffler.
customer_reviews.author: JonH

customer_reviews.title: Used against noisy neighbors
customer_reviews.text: The walls at our apartment are super thin, and our neighbors have a child that screams more times per day than I can count. I got two packs of these and placed them in 4 square blocks around the apartment. While these don't totally drown out the sound, they definitely have helped reduce the sound. I adhered these with command hook strips. They tend to fall off the wall because we only used one strip per square, so I recommend using more than one strip.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, and arrived mangled. Discovered after ordering that this type of foam doesn't help minimize sound reflections at all. Audio snake oil... Don't bother. Purchase, or build your own sound-absorbing/deadening panels for actual, useful results. NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Layla Marie

customer_reviews.title: Smell, Hard to Install, yet Effective
customer_reviews.text: These definitely have a smell to them. I had to let the product air out for several days due to the smell. They do not have any sort of adhesive. I chose to use command poster strips. Unfortunately you have to place multiple strips to keep them from moving. They reduce sound effectively. They were used as my bedroom echoed horribly which made the sound louder. They also reduce noise from the kitchenette on the other side of the wall. They are effective, however having their own adhesive backing would be a major improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really seem worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It's not that they're not good, it's just that, I guess, it was not what I was expecting for the price. These are literally just pieces of packing foam cut into 12" x 12" sections. I was expecting some kind of higher quality sound absorbing foam like an acoustic panel, but these are just... foam. I think you would have to buy A LOT and cover your entire studio with them or use them to make some sort of mic box in order to get good utility out of them. I won't rate them too badly as, I don't know, maybe I was just expecting too much.
customer_reviews.author: alan eby

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how cheap these were - well, it's because they're maybe 1/3 or 1/2 of how thick all other sound proofing is. The peak of the triangles is 1", the most shallow part is less than 1cm. Might be good for musicians but if you're sound proofing an apartment (which is what I've been doing for years and this is the third sound proofing foam brand I've purchased) they're borderline useless. I put them over a thin door (which I've done in two other apartments) and it has had almost no effect.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Blaszko

customer_reviews.title: Faux room treatment. Excellent Aesthetics.
customer_reviews.text: These panels are perfect for aesthetics. Filling in gaps where you already have real room treatment in place. They are not dense enough to "absorb" any sound, and certainly not capable of diffusing anything below 5k dB spectrum, and saying that is a stretch in itself. I have not tested my room for frequency changes, but my ears haven't failed me yet. Buy them for the aesthetic appeal. They look great covering drywall or panel. Do not purchase these as a real solution to sound diffusing or "soundproofing" (there's really no such thing as soundproofing guys)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong!
customer_reviews.text: You get exactly what you paid for. You kinda have to understand that this isn't soundproofing. Soundproofing costs an extraordinary amount of money. This is what we do to dampen echo and noise bleed and for most people, that is enough to improve their current audio capacity. This isn't the thickest foam tile I've purchased, but honestly I think it's doing what I wanted it to do. Be creative with your panelling of it too. They can make for an aesthetic design if you so desire. Just remember to research the strategic locations where you should place these in your room.
customer_reviews.author: The 3am Impulse Buyer

customer_reviews.title: The Podcast and Chill Show
customer_reviews.text: (Follow @Podandchillshow) Bought these sound panels to complete my in-home Podcast studio for "The Podcast and Chill Show". I placed these all around the room and it is completely quiet. these sound panels look amazing and I would recommend these those looking to start a low budget studio to pick them up now!.
customer_reviews.author: kelley kemp

customer_reviews.title: Works! But I would suggest another product..
customer_reviews.text: This foam is great, it certainly takes unwanted reflections and standing waves out of the room, however it does not come with any adhesive (which is fine I was expecting that) but after ordering 16-18 bags of it roughly I realized some bags have a color discrepancy.. some pieces of foam are black black and some are a slight grey black when you are paying over 1$ per foam square that’s kinda a big problem.. at this price (and they even just recently raised the price by like 2$ I believe) I would suggest going elsewhere and maybe picking up 2” foam because at this price point you practically can get that.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hussey

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for this time
customer_reviews.text: These are paper thin. I expected them to be thin, but not that thin. 1" to top of wedge (which is what I expected), but in the "valley" some of these are merely tissue paper. my other 1" wedges from a name brand are 1/4" thick in the "valley" of the wedge. these have inconsistent thickness from piece to piece, but overall each one is too thin to be of any good use. To solve some of the issue, i've alternated a 1" wedge next to a 2" wedge from the same company, and those ones are much better quality. would not buy these 1" again.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what I was thinking
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t do anything to muffle sound as described :( I have really noisy neighbors, so I was excited when this product was listed as on of the top 5 things to buy for that purpose. Not worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Robins

customer_reviews.title: Mixed thoughts, read the review
customer_reviews.text: High hopes that this would reduce the washer/dryer noise in the closet. I used 2 long, double sided pieces of tape to secure the foam directly to the wall, which took about 30 minutes, only for all of the foam pieces to fall off a couple hours later. I might use super glue to adhere the double sided tape to the foam, not sure if it hears through the tape yet. It seemed to work, but it might just be me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically Pleasing, That Is All.
customer_reviews.text: I sent these back as I didn't need them anymore but I cannot seeing these doing anything but being aesthetically pleasing if you want the sound studio look added to a room.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Dodgers

customer_reviews.title: Ripped off!!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised number of panels not provided. Only contained 10 panels not 12 as advertised. Will have to find other panels for job. Very poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: gndc

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased! They are thin as expected for the price. They work for my recording needs. I literally stapled them into the wall. I didn’t fool with glue, tape or adhesives. I’m a singer/ songwriter with a corner of a room that I record in. I do voice over as well. All good! I bought (1) pack of 12 and then bought a second pack (via Amazon Prime). Arrived on time in an airtight plastic packaging inside the box. I have NO COMPLAINTS!
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated 1

customer_reviews.title: Mounted them to cardboard with 3M spray adhesive then mounted the cardboard to the wall for easy reuse /
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my computer room since my daughters room is right on the other side, now she isn't woken up by me talking at normal volume into a mic. Mounted them to cardboard with 3M spray adhesive then mounted the cardboard to the wall for easy reuse / removal
customer_reviews.author: Julie Neville

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on the walls and foam cuts easy
customer_reviews.text: Have a small office in my home, very loud out side with the cars and trucks driving by. Easy to put on the walls and foam cuts easy also
customer_reviews.author: Heidi S

customer_reviews.title: I can still hear myself thinking
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure you need a whole wall of these for you to notice any major differences in noice reduction. But...I only have the 12 so i'm giving this three stars because if 12 is advertised to do somethkng, it should be able to do something. Also, you could honestly just buy foam from home depot or something and tape it to your walls. These don't come with any adhesive tape to stick it to your walls.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Truong

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I mean, its pretty much what I expected. 12 squares, all 1ft by 1ft What the review asks me to rate... - Adhesion: Didn’t come with any (don’t think it claims to either). - Absorbency: Meh, it’s not thick but it helps with some of the echo in my room. - Noise Cancellation: I only have the 12 on a small wall so it doesn’t cancel any noise for me... They’re cheap so I wasn’t expecting much. I’d consider buying more later if I decide to completely cover my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: These are not for absorbing sound. They are for scattering. To be completely honest they are more for an aesthetic use than for sound...
customer_reviews.author: Dorian Bagni

customer_reviews.title: Work great for insulating sound
customer_reviews.text: Work great for insulating sound! I wish they could be a little thinner, but worth it for the silence of a teenager yelling at his video games.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Not very consistent between sets.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set and they were pretty good dense foam panels so I bought another set. The second set of panels aren't even close to what the first set looks like. They are a brighter color and very soft not dense like that other. It's like a different company made them for a fraction of the cost. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle P.

customer_reviews.title: Your answer to great room acoustics.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a huge difference in sound. Keeps it under control right where you need it depending on placement and how many. Just try things out as you go. I have a music room (bedroom size) where I have drums, guitars, keyboards and my son practicing his trumpet. We are all very happy with the results. I ended up not using 4 of the panels and applied the to walls and ceiling using liquid nails.
customer_reviews.author: kingricker

customer_reviews.title: better to just save the packaging from something ordered in ...
customer_reviews.text: Very thin and just basic foam; better to just save the packaging from something ordered in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: bd2

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive fix for loud AC closet intake
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to help reduce sound of my loud central AC intake located in a closet next to living room. Made four baffles under AC intake from foam core and covered them with these tiles, secured these with carpet tape. Made a difference. Ordering another set to line wall and floor of AC intake
customer_reviews.author: Gato Flaco

customer_reviews.title: Well made, uniform and inexpensive.  Can't ask for much more than that.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality fo these. They're only 1" thick, but they are uniform in apperance and they work great and changing the sound profile of a room (my desired use). They're also inexpensive, which is a serious bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! The product doesn’t come with adhesions
customer_reviews.text: Outside of the fact that there’s no adhesions these are great pads that look amazing on the wall and does the job well. If your using mounting tape be sure to be generous. The porous surface of the pads doesn’t stick well so use a lot of tape. Two or three full length stops should be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, I bought a second set.
customer_reviews.text: Ended up buying a second set of the black 12 pack because of how happy I was with the first. They really look good and are high quality. A tiny bit thinner than I thought they would be but for a starting studio they are everything you need and more.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Get Your Hopes Up
customer_reviews.text: They're ok. Not great, just ok. They're really not nearly dense enough in my opinion. I have them all over my guitar room and I can't tell a lick of difference in sound. They tear really easily and feel rather "cheap" overall.
customer_reviews.author: AustinPaul

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for beginners and small use but for better quality definitely pay for better.
customer_reviews.text: They are a cheap form of sound proofing and will really only help to cut down on a little bit of noise scattering. I tend to just wrap a piece around my snowball to keep the back muffled. They don't stick most adhesive materials I've tried so I'd look up what the manufacturer recommends using and try that. If all else fails, they make your studio "look" professional.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: A tad too thin
customer_reviews.text: I honestly did not seem to notice a difference after installation, but then again these panels are pretty thin. If you are going to purchase these I would recommend getting 2 packs for the full effect.
customer_reviews.author: gabe

customer_reviews.title: Primarily cosmetic panels.
customer_reviews.text: These were shipped fast and met the description but what was lacking in the description was a table of Noise Reduction Coefficients at various frequencies. The next time I purchase this type of product I'll be looking for that table. This product is made from extremely lightweight foam that offers virtually no reduction in reflected sound.
customer_reviews.author: JamesCA

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seems to block out much noises. Cheap quality. I have a glass window in my bedroom and I can hear traffic noises from outside (not that noisy but enough to bug me at night). I bought this and glued two pieces together hoping to increase the thickness. I used 48 pieces together for my window but it didn't even help one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey N

customer_reviews.title: Great for work from home situations
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and use these to soundproof the door of my office so I can't hear my family when I work. I stuck them to foam boards used for science projects and stapled to my door with heavy duty staples. The noise cancelling is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tomi

customer_reviews.title: Too thin and weak , probably don't absorb much
customer_reviews.text: These don't even keep a square shape, I tried to make a panel with them and there's separation between them because they came in not a perfectly square shape. I would buy thicker panels, because these are really just not that great.
customer_reviews.author: ak05

customer_reviews.title: 2 different batches
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 batches of acoustic panels but the 2nd batch of 12 was thinner than the 1st batch of 12. The integrity of the 2nd batch was subpar, not as thick. I did not truly realize this until I finished putting it all up on the walls. BUYER BEWARE if you buy more than 1 pack of 12.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: These are fine.
customer_reviews.text: These are a fine product. We ordered two sets and they were as described. I only knocked down a star because one was ripped. We were able to make it work without the hassle of a return.
customer_reviews.author: KTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Keep Up
customer_reviews.text: Use with command stripes but overtime I see them on the ground in my room. Not sure if this is because of the command stripes I use or because of the foam boards being a hard material to stick to. Overall I do enjoy having them hanging up around my room. I have two sets of these now.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Better than the alternative pricewise anyway starting a studio slap a few of these up
customer_reviews.author: sirgeo

customer_reviews.title: Check to make sure they're square before putting them up.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really give these more than 3 stars because of consistency. I ordered two cases and the first set were square, 12x12. The second set threw off my entire arrangement as they were cut differently. They were about 12.5x11.5. I was going to do a full grid, but now have to figure something else out as there are gaps all over the place now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Accilien

customer_reviews.title: Used to reduce the noise that I hear from an air compressor. These worked surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.text: I have an air compressor in a small shed behind my workshop. Despite being in the shed, I could still hear the compressor when it was on from inside my workshop. I lined the walls of the shed with these panels, unsure of how effective they would be, but was surprised with how much less noise comes out of my shed with the compressor running.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked!
customer_reviews.text: Our bedroom is right next to my brother’s. The house was built a long time ago so there’s really no sound proofing in between the walls. He used to complain about our TV being really loud, ever since we bought these.. no complaints! We even tested to see if the TV can be heard from the other side of the wall, not a sound of the TV!
customer_reviews.author: SharedAmazon H&C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Results
customer_reviews.text: This product is of good quality and as described. I do audio book narration and have used this foam in my home studio. I've had excellent results. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to improve their recording quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality.  Easy construction of panels.
customer_reviews.text: Used in trial room setup with SBT > Cherry DAC DAC 1 HS > Cherry MEGA MK2 Monoblocks > Magnepan 1.7i. Panels were constructed using thick banner paper as backing and nailed to the walls with small thin nails to reduce wall marking. Spray adhesive was used to stick the panels to the banner paper. System sounds amazing! Only complaint is that the two packs used for this project were slightly different looking. The first pack seemed denser and higher quality. The second pack also required slightly more adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: Audio Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Good product, low quantity
customer_reviews.text: I got them to test out how well they would do to dampen the noise in my room. I did notice a difference however slight it was. Since there's only 12 of them, they don't cover much space. I would buy these again but, for the sake of convenience, I think I'm going to go with a larger sized pack (one that has 30+). If these came in larger pack options, I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Nordgren

customer_reviews.title: They look nice but results are minor
customer_reviews.text: I find them to look nice but I don't really notice a difference in sound absorption compared to other random items on a wall. They do not come with any type of adhesive so you have to find your own way to put them on the wall. Do to my walls being a pain in the butt I used nails
customer_reviews.author: Globalhawk123

customer_reviews.title: Good for budget
customer_reviews.text: They aren't black and grey they just look like faded black. They work okay. I expected them to come with some tape but didn't. Regular clear tape wont work for them so o may have to use duct tape which sucks but I mean I'm on a budget so they're ok
customer_reviews.author: gisy gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Change up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered black panels, but when they arrived they were medium gray. It doesn't specify in the description, but the image looks like every other black panel. C'mon.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Aune

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately do not reduce noise
customer_reviews.text: These flat out don’t work i covered an entire door with-no spaces went on the other side and there was no difference in noise level. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: kg

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with any way to attach to walls
customer_reviews.text: So, if these foam pads don’t come with any adhesive to stick them to walls, why do they exist? They also don’t come with any form of instructions. Garbage
customer_reviews.author: Derek Wang

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I have a home office and I needed to cut down on the echo for conference calls. I put up 24 of these in the corner (and ceiling) where my office phone is and I no longer have the echo in the room. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: ID-27529Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Evaluate other options
customer_reviews.text: They don’t add any value. I’ve spent over 100$ for less than 5db reduction. Using the styrofoam from boxes is performing better. Perhaps it’s better if it were thicker?
customer_reviews.author: Booked

customer_reviews.title: Do what they were intended to do
customer_reviews.text: These have worked really well so far and done what they were purposed to do. I plan on adhering them to a curved board eventually, or just flat board to put on a wall... but for a quick setup I just put them inside a box and it worked just fine... for now. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: jalcruces

customer_reviews.title: Makes a real difference!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect much, but wanted to create a studio effect in the room where my husband to plays guitar. He says it really does change and improve the sound in there, in combination with the Acoustic Foam Bass Trap Studio Corners I installed too.
customer_reviews.author: Joolie

customer_reviews.title: Super thin
customer_reviews.text: the ridges are fine but at the bottom, the foam is so thin that I don't really trust it's going to help my room sonically. that being said, they are pretty affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have some white noise from a sump pump and AC unit in a closet I want to minimize. I covered the walls and door with these panels and saw zero improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Teenager Approved
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the panels. We decided to use them to look like a headboard. We had a difficult time finding something to hold them... We ended up using Elmers spray glue... Still having to fix some here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest but they get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest on Earth but the price was right and they are doing their job. If you're not happy with them and you probably should have spent more money.
customer_reviews.author: G money

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered these twice and the 2nd time they only sent me 10 and not 12 of them. I used command strips to put them on the wall. I use them to block the noise out from my dog who goes crazy when shes home alone.
customer_reviews.author: amandar

customer_reviews.title: Thin but sturdy Unless you're just trying to rip it apart there's ...
customer_reviews.text: Thin but sturdy Unless you're just trying to rip it apart there's no reason these should tear easy I've removed them like 6 times on and off my door before putting them in a new official spot on a wall and there was no tearing of pieces lifted off of any sort
customer_reviews.author: TMDJCBeatz

customer_reviews.title: Good for noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing, if you're looking for cheap soundproof panels that are good, I 100% suggest these. I bought 24 of them and they're so dope I'm so happy with them and they definitely help with the noise cancellation in my room. Buuuut if you have the money go for panels that are 2 inches. If you don't have the money, these are the best you can get :)
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: good purchase. Will probably order more in the
customer_reviews.text: Definitely noticed a difference in sound quality by ordering these. Im gonna knock a few stars off for not offering a mounting application. Had to buy some double sided tape to mount these. Other than that, good purchase. Will probably order more in the future
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: These work well, I was able to apply to the wall and it helps absorb some of the sound for my podcast.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Voss

customer_reviews.title: It tamed the speakers down and helped with making them sound much better. better bass
customer_reviews.text: bought this item to line the inside of my ceiling speaker enclosures i built and they improved the sound greatly. It tamed the speakers down and helped with making them sound much better. better bass, cleaned up the mids and highs.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: These alone won't reduce much echo!
customer_reviews.text: These alone won't reduce much echo, but if you pair them with higher quality panels and just have these spread around your room they help out alot with reducing echo. I would definitely recommend this product to aspiring YouTubers! Thanks! - GRIFBYgames and MOAR!
customer_reviews.author: Gianni

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's good for small rooms where you have to do a lot of talking it. It cancels out most of the echos and reverberations. A must need for any who does a lot of talking for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Dat Boi Avlan

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for a cheap and dirty fix in a small space. I have my disk in the corner of my studio apartment, so I just lined the two walls in the corner with these to make my mic pick up a bit less noise from the ac.
customer_reviews.author: Calico Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My son put it up in his room so his audio recordings would sound better. He's been pleased with the outcome with only one package put up around the room in various locations. He put it up himself and said it was simple.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm an indie recording artist and bought these for my home studio. These were the cheapest I found and was worried at first. However, they made a big difference in the acoustics in my upstairs studio. I added a few bass traps and that was it. I've bought a few of these sets so far
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Grayce Music

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and does help. I would get the thicker one next time. I got the thinnest this time around. Still great.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: You'll need a way to mount them, so plan on that. I used thumb tacks in opposite corners. Keeps the noise in my office contained so I can work while my family sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: z.bar1

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Bought multiple!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to block in noise from my husband's drum playing. It is doing the job for the most part. I also hid his drumsticks tho. Not sure which one is the solution but one of them is.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: NOT BLACK
customer_reviews.text: NOT BLACK!! Medium grey at best. Wish I knew that before ordering 108.. NOT 12”x12”. Close but they’re cheap so material is meh and sizing fluctuates. Stretch when applying to meet your 12” needs.
customer_reviews.author: Denver McQuaid

customer_reviews.title: They were alright
customer_reviews.text: They were okay, however they would collect alot of dust even when you clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Non B.

customer_reviews.title: A decent budget option
customer_reviews.text: It does its job just fine in my home studio, but my second order came in with panels that were not exactly square. One dimension is shorter by half a centimeter or so; not enough to ruin the project, but more planning had to go into their arrangement when covering a wall.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: A Good Starting Point
customer_reviews.text: First off, don't expect 12 of these panels, to soundproof a room. They might help to deaden a room, however, in my experience, they work best in small spaces, like a collapsible fabric box-turned vocal booth, or a small closet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Deadens sound, but won't block it
customer_reviews.text: These won't block out sound from another room, but they'll deaden the sound a bit. They worked perfectly for decreasing the echoey-ness of my dorm room when dispersed across the walls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I wish they had been a little bit thicker and there needs to be a guide on what you can use to attach them with. The rubber cement I first used ate holes in them. The sound baffling they provide is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great price compared to other brands. Easy to adhere. Do the job they’re supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: brandon white

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these because they were not what I expected. It's literally just foam, very thin foam at that. It didn't come with any adhesive backing and I wasn't sure how I would put it all together.
customer_reviews.author: AGB

customer_reviews.title: Not great but Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: These foam squares have no self sticking backing. They're pretty good sound dampeners.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more than flimsy foam. Does not noticeably reduce noise levels. Works OK as foam padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Pournelle

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: These were as described but didn't really make any different in the sound coming through the door
customer_reviews.author: dvh1919

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: These are very lightweight and do not help with noise cancellation at all. I would not recommend l.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Although it took a while to get in the mail (not the sellers fault was the Delivery Companies fault!) it looks and sounds perfect. I’m buying more as I type this!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Does an okay job blocking sound and is really great value in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: About the size of one door. Does an okay job blocking sound and is really great value in my opinion. I used a staple gun to install, but I am sure there are plenty of ways to install this.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: They do seem to help
customer_reviews.text: I can tell a difference on my door I covered. I can tell it is quieter and less "echo" in the room, For the price I can't complain, wishing I had gone with 2" vs 1" but didn't want it to stand out too much...I just stapled mine to the door and seemed to work well
customer_reviews.author: Mark A in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Did not live up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I live in a large apartment complex and it gets kind of noisy. I was hoping that it would absorb some of the noise especially at night. However, I found that it really doesn’t do anything but look funky on my walls. I wish that this product worked a little bit better
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Wilfong

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Ok, could stick to stucco walls better, but does it’s job
customer_reviews.author: RichardH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, but only if you get a good batch.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these three times and the first two batches were amazing and I wanted to buy more, but when I received my third one, most of the panels weren't the same size and they were not an 1" thick. The sides were torn at every raised bump. I understand that they're cut in a certain way, but these were just not great. If you get lucky, you may get a good batch that are 1" thick.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Hart

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up the way you want it!
customer_reviews.text: Helps me to eliminate redundant and unwanted noise. The best part is that you can set them up the way you want to!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I should've considered that 1" means from bottom to peak ...
customer_reviews.text: I should've considered that 1" means from bottom to peak. These are very thin and almost ready to break apart. I used them to line the ceiling of a drum enclosure, and I wish I would've used something a little thicker or higher quality. I still give it 4 stars because I think I got what I paid for :)
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Look good, not for soundproofing, rather just reduction.
customer_reviews.text: It did the job. Mine measured out to be 1 1/8th inch thick then 12x12 so cant complain. But much cheaper from china if you dont mind waiting. Also use double sided tape to hang them up, much cheaper especially if you plan on doing multiple walls/rooms
customer_reviews.author: Steve Drive600

customer_reviews.title: Excelent PADs
customer_reviews.text: I'm not doing a super sound proof area, so i just need little to none reverb and echo cancellation, which i find perfect in this product, it comes well packed, and they are just perfect for what i'm going to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Theus One

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love them, they made my home studio look and sound amazing
customer_reviews.author: paola silva

product_meta.title: Mybecca 12 PACK Acoustic Foam Wedge Soundproofing Wall Tiles 12" X 12" X 1", Charcoal
feature_bullets: Each WEDGE comes uncompressed and in prime condition! The Wedges in the photo will be exactly what you get. 6 Pairs of 1 Inch Acoustic Panels - Uncompressed and in Prime Condition
Installation Guide -- 2 pack means 12 pieces, your package must include 12 pieces (6 sets), they are tied together, (6 Set), EACH TILE Splits into "2 WEDGES".

Great for spot treating walls in your studio or office - For use in recording studios, control rooms, Offices home studios, home entertainment theaters, Home Offices . Covers an area of 12 square feet, each Panel is 1 square foot by 1 inch thick

Ideal for reducing echo such as Studios, Recording Studios, Vocal Booths, Control Rooms, Offices, Home Studios, Home Entertainment Theaters, Gaming Rooms, and Home Offices.more enjoyable sound by effectively controlling unwanted reverb and echo.

Size -- 1" x 12" x 12”; Noise Reduction: 80-90%; Color: Charcoal Each Acoustic Wedge is 12” Length 12” Width and 1” Thick. This 12 Pack covers 12 square feet Color: Charcoal - Each tile is 1 square foot of 1-inch thick acoustic wedge.
